description: Questions about W3 health check templates and Docker patterns for Health Monitoring implementation

context.background: mcp-orchestration achieved 100% chora-base adoption (18/18 SAPs) and needs W3-specific health patterns for Health Monitoring implementation
context.relationship: Template consumer - we want to use chora-base patterns rather than custom implementation

relevant_saps: SAP-011: Docker Operations (multi-stage builds, health checks)

questions.question: Are health check templates W3-ready? Current status?
questions.importance: High - determines whether we use templates or custom implementation

questions.question: Docker deployment template ready? Is it included in chora-base v4.1.0?
questions.workaround: Can use custom Docker setup if needed

questions.question: Documentation completeness? Can we self-service or need guidance?
What are best practices for health monitoring? (polling intervals, failure thresholds)
questions.importance: High - affects health check implementation quality

questions.question: Auto-recovery patterns? (restart strategies, exponential backoff)
questions.our_approach: Exponential backoff with max 5 min, circuit breaker pattern

questions.question: Telemetry integration for health status changes? Event logging patterns?
Template usage examples? Other projects using successfully?
Measured ROI data? What's the evidence for 200-300% claim?
Support available if templates don't fit our use case?

use_templates_if: Align with our health monitoring requirements
custom_implementation_if: Templates don't fit our use case

timeline.workaround_acceptable: Can implement custom, migrate to templates later (1-2 day delay)

value_proposition.for_chora_base: Validates health check templates with production use case
value_proposition.for_ecosystem: Reusable health patterns for other MCP servers
